intro: Seriphidium kemrudicum, commonly known as the Karakorum wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, branched stems and small, yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oblong leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Seriphidium kemrudicum is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
